text:
When adding an alias to a mapped network drive in the httpd.conf file, Apache 
can no longer be started as a service (error code 1). However, it does start 
from the command line. Once started this way, the aliased directory is 
accessible from a different system.

Here are the particulars:
Alias description:

Alias /sampling "Z:/web/sampling"
<Directory "Z:/web/sampling">
    Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
    AllowOverride None
    Order allow,deny
    Allow from all
</Directory>

The mapped drive is an NFS mount using MS Windows Services for Unix 3.5. The 
mount is to a Solaris 8 system.
creator: r-sutcliffe1@ti.com
slive@apache.org
text:
The user running the apache service doesn't have permission to access the
network drive.  Either change the Run-As user, or change that user's permissions.

Since this is a configuration question, and not a bug report, please address
similar questions to a user support forum like the users@httpd.apache.org
mailing list.

Thanks for using Apache.
